Articles.Content:
I know that I'm 9 days late with this post, but I had been working on a Photoshop painting to commemorate the 44th anniversary of the Apollo 11 moon landing, and also to salute the very commander who died almost a year ago, Neil Armstrong. I had set my deadline for the 20th, and I finished the painting on the dot. It's a very somber piece, so it's all right if you do shed a tear for a fallen legend, our hero.

Click on the image, it's linked to my deviantART.
Wow! That was amazing. You made that all by yourself?

Wow! That was amazing. You made that all by yourself?

Sorry for the late reply, but yes I did this all on my own. I don't have any collaborators of any kind, I work alone. I was short on time for doing it, but I did the best I could in the 4-5 days I had to do it. I would've been mad at myself if I finished it later than the 20th. I'm glad you enjoyed it. I try not to weep for our fallen hero, but sometimes it's a bit too much. I'm still grieving for him, even though it's been almost a year. He was my one true hero to the very end. And whenever the full moon is out, I'd ask, "How's it going, Commander?"
